channel.title: Neo4J on Øyvind Monsen
channel.description: Recent content in Neo4J on Øyvind Monsen

item.title: An introduction to Neo4j
item.description: What is Neo4j Neo4j is a graph database. Now what is a graph database you ask? Instead of storing data in tables like in traditional relational databases like MySQL, graph databases store data as nodes in a graph. Each datapoint is a node, and relations between nodes are edges in the graph. In a relational database this would be accomplished by having references to other rows, so why should we bother having the data in a graph?
